page.title: 05FARMING: LORD OF THE MANOR
page.content: Guy Van der Gucht is the{Squire of {Apperley and Deerhurst}and he lives at {Apperley Court.}A 100 years ago his family owned about 450 acres and 50 cottages. Now he owns 550 acres and has 38 free holders living on his estate. The Estate consists of meadows, woods and cultivated land and 60 beef stock. Today the land is worth about Â£1 million. {Wightfield Manor}is a{Norman}manor house which was originally built and used by the monks of Deerhurst Church. It was then called Wightfield Court and is listed in the original Domesday book. The building consists of mostly stone,purloined from dissolved monasteries, with an original moat still intact. The {magistrates' court} was held here formerly and the farm buildings were built to supply food during the Napoleonic blockade.
